author: radekkapka
content: Hi there! I have a question about https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Beacon/submitPoolAttestations

author: radekkapka
content: The example request value is an array, not an object with a top-level `data` field. Is this accidental or deliberate? Should this endpoint handle a top-level array instead of an object of the form `{ "data": [...] }`?

author: jgm
content: An array is correct.  The object-and-data is for responses, as that allows us to add metadata.  The idea is that if the client is sending data it already knows what it's sending, and the server will validate it independently, so no metadata required.
